data.description: Average property price data scraped from https://www.gov.uk/government/news/uk-house-price-index-for-december-2019 using a scraper I built: https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1KdVxsbPt8qM6nPXVhv9hjnrZZY-crRSa?usp=sharing. Gross disposable household income per capita data from https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/regionalaccounts/grossdisposablehouseholdincome/datasets/regionalgrossdisposablehouseholdincomegdhi. I combined the datasets after scraping, calculated the price to income ratio, saved as a CSV, uploaded to GitHub then used that to attach the price to income ratio to a topojson file which can be found here https://martinjc.github.io/UK-GeoJSON/json/eng/topo_eer.json. The steps I took are in this notebook: https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1kY1AZP26J5CZQ5BRKi6VAhnWvNOoYv_t?usp=sharing

title.text: Regional Property Prices Relative to Income
title.subtitle: Price to Income Ratio = Average House Price/Gross Disposable Household Income
